intro: Melanthium wurmbeum, commonly known as the yellow false nettle, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, triangular stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a hairy texture, and the flowers are often surrounded by bracts that resemble leaves. Melanthium wurmbeum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in forest understories.
